results.title: I like maths
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions, Neville Stanley and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
Introduces three teachers from Corio West Primary School who have developed a series of mathematical “games” to make mathematics more relevant to real-life situations.

results.title: I know where I'm going
results.creator_credit: Archers Film Productions, Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburger
results.brief_description: Joan (Wendy Hiller) has known exactly what she wanted since childhood, and all her dreams are to come true with her forthcoming marriage to a millionaire - but a storm strands her on a remote Hebridean island and the forces of nature conspire to change her mind. With its overwhelming sense of place and stunning visual effects, this most personal of Powell and Pressburger’s films is also one of their most perfect. “I had reached the point of thinking there were no more masterpieces, until I saw ‘I Know Where I’m Going’.” Martin Scorsese
results.creator_credit_for_label: Archers Film Productions, Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburger

results.title: I Know what you did last summer
results.creator_credit: Mandalay Entertainment, Neal H. Moritz, Eric Feig, Stokely Chaffin and Jim Gillespie
results.brief_description: Following their graduation, friends Julie, Helen, Ray and Barry get into Barry’s new BMW and head for the beach to celebrate the end of an important chapter in their lives. This sudden decision leads them on a path which will change their lives inexorably when they accidentally hit a pedestrian on deserted road. After the initial shock of what has happened has abated, they decide to toss the evidence, his body- into the ocean and swear secrecy to the event ever taking place. A year passes, the friendships have deteriorated, and strange things begin to happen. An anonymous note saying “I know what you did last summer” brings the accident on the road to life again, forcing the four friends to wonder whether someone has broken the promise of secrecy, or whether there was someone else on the road that day. Based on the novel by Lois Duncan. Screenplay by Kevin Williamson. Cast includes Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr, and Anne Heche.

results.title: I Know they can get me pregnant (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Would-be mothers, patients at the In-Vitro Fertilisation Clinic at the Royal North Shore Hospital, describe their feelings. This program provides material for discussion on such topics as the role of the social worker, the ethics of test-tube babies and the care of patients.

results.title: I know an old lady who swallowed a fly
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Colin Low, Tom Daly and Derek Lamb
results.brief_description: A nonsense song, sung by Burl Ives and given unrestrained interpretation by the cartoonist. Of course, by the time the song ends the old lady has swallowed much more than a fly. Written by Canadian folksinger Alan Mills. (Awards: Santa Barbara; Chicago; Gottwaldov)

results.title: I Know a secret (K)
results.creator_credit: Atlantis Films, Michael Macmillan, Seaton McLean, Janice Platt and Bruce Pittman
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of a short story by Lucy Maud Montgomery set during the late 1930s. The story is about a young girl called Jane Lawrence, and some children she becomes acquainted with after she moves to the country with her mother to live.
